title: Translation of "I died as a full 600 armor tank rammus in 2 secs to an all AD comp"
body: "I ran in 1v5, without my team being in range to follow up on my dice, proceeded to be kited for the next 5-7 seconds and died. Wtf tanks are so weak, lethality is fucking broken why can't I walk in 1v5 and kill their carry and then come out with 40% hp remaining, remember the good ole days when tanks didn't die in 2 seconds which was never??"

replies.body: Translation: I'm playing Rammus with 540 armor and 4k health and MF kills me in half a second with or without her ult.

> [{quoted}](name=Sciela,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VfEXAhRk,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-02-15T00:31:22.788+0000)
>
> Translation: I'm playing Rammus with 540 armor and 4k health and MF kills me in half a second with or without her ult.

sometimes I enjoy a side of nachos with my plate of bullshit.

Let's actually drop the maths on that.

A fairly standard 5 item MF build is {{item:3142}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3814}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3156}} and an {{item:2140}} . With this build and the 24 lethality page + 18/12/0 spec she has 310 bonus AD for 373 total AD. She also has 59 lethality.

Let's start by working out what our 540 Rammus's armour will be VS this, Rammus has a base armour of 104. That means the calc for the pen are (540x.7)x.093-(540-104)x0.45-59=96 total armour. With 96 armour Rammus has 1.96x as much EHP as HP, so 7.84k EHP VS the MF.

Now the question is how much damage does MFs ult do? MFs Ult has 16 waves at 75% total AD scaling+3 for AP from masteries, that's a total of 283 per wave, or 4524 total damage, this is multiplied by 1.15 by LDR and 1.05 by DeS, for a total of 5463 raw damage, around two thirds of a full tank Rammus's HP.

So Rammus won't literally die to an MF ult, although if anything else hits him in the duration he probably will die since it's dealing over half of his HP. If you sub in most other tanks and don't give 540 armour (which most tanks don't have the luxury of) they drop to under 500 from just an MF ult.

Let me quickly get the numbers for a 350 armour 100 base armour tank, more in the range of sanity for most champs. At 350 armour that equation becomes (350x.7)x.093-(350-100)x0.45-59=56, they only have 6.24k with the same 4K HP. That Bullet time is now so close to killing them that an extra AA from the MF will probably do it.

This is what pen is doing to tanks right now, it's knocking off so much armour that they just fail at their job of tanking.

This keeps champion diversity in the game, it's a good thing to have champs and even classes that say "your team is too heavily loaded in this way so you have no options VS me". Pick tanks so Katarina or Yi don't run trough your comp, pick a mix of damage so tanks don't become invincible, don't pick all tanks so you don't just lose DPS wars. These are important rules to have because they stop the game from devolving into a 3 class shitfest like it has now. All you see currently are poke heavy ADCs, Divers and assassins. The order is %reduction, flat reduction, %pen, flat pen. That means the first thing that applies is TBC, then Masteries, then LDR, then lethality. LDR also gives 0 fucks what your total armour is, it just checks your bonus armour as a whole. Because of this it's actually possible for the number LDR checks to be higher than your total armour at the time, thanks to basically lazy coding.

Well, that is calculated incorrectly. I was hoping you'd have gotten it right so I wouldn't have to do this, But...

First, we have to consider that Black Cleaver takes six rounds of MF ult to achieve full percentage reduction, so we'll calculate it wave by wave until that point is reached.

And pretty much everything except the lethality will be multiplicatively stacking with LDR, not additively as it seems to be in your calculations which is big.

The formula  for effective armor is... [((1 - 0.05t) 104) x 0.93)] + [((1-0.05t) 436) x 0.55 x 0.93)] - 59 where t is stacks of black cleaver, up to 6.

So calculating the effective armor on hit value for the first 7 waves and damage, we get:

Formula: 

(100 x 1.15 x 1.02 x 276.5) / (100 + Eff. Armor)

1. 260.73 >> 92.55
2. 244.75 >> 96.85
3. 228.76 >> 101.55
4. 212.77 >> 106.75
5. 196.79 >> 112.5
6. 180.8 >> 118.9 
7++. 164.81 >> 126.08

Total damage: ~1889.9

Full build rammus typically has at least 4k health. If you itemized full armor, that's health from randuins, sunfire, deadman's, hell throw in a warmogs and you're nearing 5k.
